body.name: Men's Tactical Belt Heavy Duty Webbing Belt Adjustable Military Style Nylon Belts
features: Quick Release Buckle - Intuitive and smooth quick release functionality when you push the golden tabs down at the same time. If just one tab is engaged, the connection will still hold and fully re-lock on its own.
Quality Nylon Belt - Made from 1000D nylon material, breathable and comfortable for daily use.

Heavy Duty Metal Buckle - This tactical belt features a military belt buckle made from heavy-duty metal.Max bearing weight 1100lb/500kg. Widely used for military training or outdoor camping expedition.

Everyday Carry Gear-The tactical belt is applicable to all kinds of overalls, casual pants, tactical trousers, and outdoor trousers as well as outdoor uses such as outward bound training like outdoor rock climbing, tactics and prompt drop. Any gun or survival equipment can be carried well for outdoor exercises.
GREAT GIFT PACKING:It comes in a gift box packing. You can buy work belts for men a worth gift for your boyfriend, father, brother, yourself, or other male friends.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite inexpensive tactical belt
reviews.reviewText: I wear this most days. It's very sturdy, good Value, easily adjustable, fits almost all my women's belt loops, including buckle. I like the easy- release tabs on the belt.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very study belt.
reviews.reviewText: I found this belt to be what I have been looking for. Very well made and comfortable. Once the length is set it does not slip. The fact that the buckle does not fit through the belt loops on my pants is a bit of a problem. But, since I usually wear my work pants for 2 - 3 days it's not too much of a hassle. And the quality of this belt is worth needing to reset it's length when changing pants. Will buy another one of these belts when it's needed. But, given it's high quality, I'm feeling that will be some time from now.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A good product. A few things to keep in mind.
reviews.reviewText: A fairly decent and well finished product. Looks good. Performing well so far.There is no play or stretch in the fabric, but its easy enough to micro-adjust to your exact measurements.This is a belt which is best for adding to a pair of pants that you intend to keep it on.Don't expect to take this bent on/off every night like you would a leather belt.This is because it has a buckle on both ends and it is difficult to push the buckle through you pant loops.You could slide the fabric out of the buckle every time to take it on/off, but then you will need to re-adjust every time to find that "sweet spot" that fits you perfectly.It is not a flaw of the belt; just typical of all belt of this design and something to keep in mind.I put them on and keep them on a pair of work pants that I don't wash every day.The buckle is quick and easy to open/close.Although, you will need to make sure that you fully push it together so that both lugs engage.A few times I didn't push it together hard enough and it popped apart when I didn't expect it.But if you latch it properly, there is no way it is coming open.All in all, a great belt, especially for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great All-around Belt
reviews.reviewText: I have a 34 waist and had to cut a significant portion away, but better to get too much than too little. LOVE THIS BELT. I use to always run rigger's belts, but got tired of the velcro wearing out and the prices going up. This is a good sturdy belt which lets the wearer add stuff to their belt without getting undressed. Comes apart just as easily by unclipping the sturdy mechanism, or unlooping the belt itself. But it doesn't come off unless you want it to. Great tactical selection as long as you don't need a no-kidding rigger's belt with D-rings. I use it for hunting and every-day wear. Ordered three more after getting my first one. Good gift too.Update: This is not a rigger's belt, nor is it intended to be. If you're buying this thinking you've found a belt to rappel with, you need to keep looking. I've been wearing these for a couple years now and the mechanism hasn't worn down, and now I have green ones too. Still probably the best all-around belt you can get for the money. My latest ones came with at least a foot of extra material that is easily cut away. Stitching has held out through range wear, hunting wear, and working outdoors in the woods. They also come with a loop keeper that I take off because it's not needed. No complaints. Very happy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Got one for me and my employees. We all love them. It's the only belt I've worn since I got it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Shorter than stated.
reviews.reviewText: It appears to be a well made belt but one major problem was found. I tried it on and the belt seemed short. I measured it and found in the length of the belt advertised the overall length is 2 inches shorter than what they say. The length they advertise includes the two buckles and the 2 inches of nylon ran through the one buckle and flipped and sewn to its self. By the time you thread the other end through the other half of the buckle you have even less. I don’t know why they even bother putting a loop on for the excess nylon. There won’t be any. I’m big so I ordered the 61 inch I thought the webbing would be 61” Nope webbing, both buckles clasped but the second not threaded was 59 inch the other two inches where through the first buckle half and sewn to its self. Not happy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Best belt ever. No stretching, no breaking, and no coming undone. So worth it!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable belt
reviews.reviewText: Love this belt, only problem is the buckle is a little big to go through some belt loops. If it were a little smaller it would be a 5 STAR.
